Package.Name: SARS-CoV-2.cl.1.0
Package.Description: Use for SARS-CoV-2 samples that are relevant to public health. Required attributes include those considered useful for the rapid analysis and trace back of SARS-CoV-2 cases.
Package.TemplateHeader: # This is a submission template for batch deposit of 'SARS-CoV-2: clinical or host-associated; version 1.0' samples to the NCBI BioSample database (https://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/biosample/). # Fields with an asterisk (*) are mandatory. Your submission will fail if any mandatory fields are not completed. If information is unavailable for any mandatory field, please enter 'not collected', 'not applicable' or 'missing' as appropriate. # All other fields are optional. Leave optional fields empty if no information is available. # You can add any number of custom fields to fully describe your BioSamples, simply include them in the table. # CAUTION: Be aware that Excel may automatically apply formatting to your data. In particular, take care with dates, incrementing autofills and special characters like / or -. Doublecheck that your text file is accurate before uploading to BioSample. # TO MAKE A SUBMISSION: # 1. Complete the template table (typically in Excel, or another spreadsheet application) # 2. Save the worksheet as a Text (Tab-delimited) file - use 'File, Save as, Save as type: Text (Tab-delimited)' # 3. Upload the file on the 'Attributes' tab of the BioSample Submission Portal at https://submit.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/subs/biosample/. # 4. If you have any questions, please contact us at biosamplehelp@ncbi.nlm.nih.gov.

Attribute.Name: collected by
Attribute.Description: Name of persons or institute who collected the sample

Attribute.Name: collection date
Attribute.Description: the date on which the sample was collected; date/time ranges are supported by providing two dates from among the supported value formats, delimited by a forward-slash character; collection times are supported by adding "T", then the hour and minute after the date, and must be in Coordinated Universal Time (UTC), otherwise known as "Zulu Time" (Z); supported formats include "DD-Mmm-YYYY", "Mmm-YYYY", "YYYY" or ISO 8601 standard "YYYY-mm-dd", "YYYY-mm", "YYYY-mm-ddThh:mm:ss"; e.g., 30-Oct-1990, Oct-1990, 1990, 1990-10-30, 1990-10, 21-Oct-1952/15-Feb-1953, 2015-10-11T17:53:03Z; valid non-ISO dates will be automatically transformed to ISO format

Attribute.Name: geographic location
Attribute.Description: Geographical origin of the sample; use the appropriate name from this list http://www.insdc.org/documents/country-qualifier-vocabulary. Use a colon to separate the country or ocean from more detailed information about the location, eg "Canada: Vancouver" or "Germany: halfway down Zugspitze, Alps"

Attribute.Name: host
Attribute.Description: The natural (as opposed to laboratory) host to the organism from which the sample was obtained. Use the full taxonomic name, eg, "Homo sapiens".

Attribute.Name: host disease
Attribute.Description: Name of relevant disease, e.g. Salmonella gastroenteritis. Controlled vocabulary, http://bioportal.bioontology.org/ontologies/1009 or http://www.ncbi.nlm.nih.gov/mesh

Attribute.Name: isolate
Attribute.Description: identification or description of the specific individual from which this sample was obtained

Attribute.Name: isolation source
Attribute.Description: Describes the physical, environmental and/or local geographical source of the biological sample from which the sample was derived.

Attribute.Name: antiviral treatment agent
Attribute.Description: What was the antiviral treatment agent?

Attribute.Name: collection device
Attribute.Description: Instrument or container used to collect sample, e.g., swab

Attribute.Name: collection method
Attribute.Description: Process used to collect the sample, e.g., bronchoalveolar lavage (BAL)

Attribute.Name: date of prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment
Attribute.Description: Date of the SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment, e.g., 2021-03-30

Attribute.Name: date of prior SARS-CoV-2 infection
Attribute.Description: Date of the prior SARS-CoV-2 infection, e.g., 2021-03-30

Attribute.Name: date of SARS-CoV-2 vaccination
Attribute.Description: Date of the 1st dose of the SARS-CoV-2 vaccine, e.g., 2021-03-30

Attribute.Name: exposure event
Attribute.Description: Event leading to exposure, e.g., mass gathering

Attribute.Name: geo loc exposure
Attribute.Description: The country where the host was likely exposed to the causative agent of the illness. This location pertains to the country the host was believed to be exposed, and may not be the same as the host's country of residence, e.g., Canada

Attribute.Name: GISAID accession
Attribute.Description: The GISAID accession assigned to the sequence. GISAID Accession Numbers are used as unique and permanent identifiers for each virus beginning with the letters EPI and followed by numbers, to identify viruses and/or segments; https://www.gisaid.org/; e.g., EPI_ISL_1091361

Attribute.Name: GISAID virus name
Attribute.Description: The full virus name submitted to GISAID (https://www.gisaid.org/), e.g., hCoV-19/Belgium/rega-3187/2021

Attribute.Name: host age
Attribute.Description: Age of host at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: host anatomical material
Attribute.Description: Host anatomical material or substance produced by the body where the sample was obtained, e.g., stool, mucus, saliva

Attribute.Name: host anatomical part
Attribute.Description: Anatomical part of the host organism (e.g. tissue) that was sampled, e.g., nasopharynx

Attribute.Name: host body product
Attribute.Description: substance produced by the host, e.g. stool, mucus, where the sample was obtained from

Attribute.Name: host disease outcome
Attribute.Description: Final outcome of disease, e.g., death, chronic disease, recovery

Attribute.Name: host health state
Attribute.Description: Information regarding health state of the individual sampled at the time of sampling

Attribute.Name: host recent travel location
Attribute.Description: The name of the country that was the destination of most recent travel. Specify the countries (and more granular locations if known) travelled, e.g., United Kingdom. Can include multiple travels; separate multiple travel events with a semicolon.

Attribute.Name: host recent travel return date
Attribute.Description: The date of a person's most recent return to some residence from a journey originating at that residence, e.g., 2021-03-30

Attribute.Name: host sex
Attribute.Description: Gender or physical sex of the host

Format.Description: male | female | pooled male and female | neuter | hermaphrodite | intersex | not determined | missing | not applicable | not collected | not provided | restricted access

Attribute.Name: host specimen voucher
Attribute.Description: Identifier for the physical specimen. Include a URI (Uniform Resource Identifier) in the form of a URL providing a direct link to the physical host specimen. If the specimen was destroyed in the process of analysis, electronic images (e-vouchers) are an adequate substitute for a physical host voucher specimen. If a URI is not available, a museum-provided globally unique identifier (GUID) can be used. URI example: http://portal.vertnet.org/o/fmnh/mammals?id=33e55cfe-330b-40d9-aaae-8d042cba7542; INSDC triplet example: UAM:Mamm:52179

Attribute.Name: host subject id
Attribute.Description: a unique identifier by which each subject can be referred to, de-identified, e.g. #131

Attribute.Name: latitude and longitude
Attribute.Description: The geographical coordinates of the location where the sample was collected. Specify as degrees latitude and longitude in format "d[d.dddd] N|S d[dd.dddd] W|E", eg, 38.98 N 77.11 W

Attribute.Name: passage method
Attribute.Description: Description of how the organism was passaged. Provide a short description, e.g., AVL buffer+30%EtOH lysate received from Respiratory Lab. P3 passage in Vero-1 via bioreactor large-scale batch passage. P3 batch derived from the SP-2/reference lab strain. If not passaged, put ""not applicable"".

Attribute.Name: passage number
Attribute.Description: The number of known passages, e.g., 3. If not passaged, put ""not applicable"".

Attribute.Name: prior SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment
Attribute.Description: Has the host received SARS-CoV-2 antiviral treatment?

Attribute.Name: prior SARS-CoV-2 infection
Attribute.Description: Did the host have a prior SARS-CoV-2 infection?

Attribute.Name: prior SARS-CoV-2 vaccination
Attribute.Description: Has the host received a SARS-CoV-2 vaccination?

Format.Description: no | yes - completed | yes - partially completed

Attribute.Name: purpose of sampling
Attribute.Description: the reason that the sample was collected, e.g., active surveillance in response to an outbreak, active surveillance not initiated by an outbreak, clinical trial, cluster investigation, environmental assessment, farm sample, field trial, for cause, industry internal investigation, market sample, passive surveillance, population based studies, research, research and development

Attribute.Name: purpose of sequencing
Attribute.Description: The reason the sample was sequenced, e.g., baseline surveillance (random sampling)

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic gene name 1
Attribute.Description: The name of the gene used in the first diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.

Format.Description: E (orf4) | M (orf5) | N (orf9) | spike (orf2) | ORF1ab (rep) | ORF1a (pp1a) | nsp11 | nsp1 | nsp2 | nsp3 | nsp4 | nsp5 | nsp6 | nsp7 | nsp8 | nsp9 | nsp10 | nsp12 (RdRp) | nsp13 (Hel) | nsp14 (ExoN) | nsp15 | nsp16 | ORF3a | ORF3b | ORF6 (ns6) | ORF7a | ORF7b (ns7b) | ORF8 (ns8) | ORF9b | ORF9c | ORF10 | ORF14

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic gene name 2
Attribute.Description: The name of the gene used in the second diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test.

Format.Description: E (orf4) | M (orf5) | N (orf9) | spike (orf2) | ORF1ab (rep) | ORF1a (pp1a) | nsp11 | nsp1 | nsp2 | nsp3 | nsp4 | nsp5 | nsp6 | nsp7 | nsp8 | nsp9 | nsp10 | nsp12 (RdRp) | nsp13 (Hel) | nsp14 (ExoN) | nsp15 | nsp16 | ORF3a | ORF3b | ORF6 (ns6) | ORF7a | ORF7b (ns7b) | ORF8 (ns8) | ORF9b | ORF9c | ORF10 | ORF14

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic pcr Ct value 1
Attribute.Description: The cycle threshold (CT) value result from the first diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test, e.g., 21

Attribute.Name: SARS-CoV-2 diagnostic pcr Ct value 2
Attribute.Description: The cycle threshold (CT) value result from the second diagnostic SARS-CoV-2 RT-PCR test, e.g., 36

Attribute.Name: sequenced by
Attribute.Description: The name of the agency that generated the sequence, e.g., Centers for Disease Control and Prevention

Attribute.Name: vaccine received
Attribute.Description: Which vaccine did the host receive, e.g., Pfizer-BioNTech COVID-19 vaccine

Attribute.Name: virus isolate of prior infection
Attribute.Description: Specific isolate of SARS-CoV-2 in prior infection (if known), e.g., SARS-CoV-2/human/USA/CA-CDPH-001/2020
